  • Violin plots

Violin plots#

Use bk.pl.violin to plot QC/clinical variables from adata.obs or gene expression (from adata.var_names) across groups.

Example violin plot showing gene expression across tumor types.

Basic usage#

bk.pl.violin(
    adata,
    keys=["CDC20", "ASCL1", "CD3D"],
    groupby="Project_ID",
    figsize=(10, 3),
)

Notes#

  • If a key is found in adata.obs, it is treated as metadata.

  • If a key is found in adata.var_names, expression is extracted from layer.

  • Supports mixed metadata + genes in a single call.

.. py:module:: bullkpy.pl.violin

.. py:function:: violin(adata, *, keys, groupby, layer=’log1p_cpm’, figsize=(8, 4), panel_size=None, show_points=True, point_size=2.0, point_alpha=0.35, palette=None, order=None, rotate_xticks=45, inner=’quartile’, cut=0.0, save=None, show=True) :module: bullkpy.pl.violin

Violin plots of sample-level variables and/or gene expression across groups.

This function behaves Scanpy-like: each entry in keys is interpreted as (i) an adata.obs column if present, otherwise (ii) a gene in adata.var_names.

:type adata: :sphinx_autodoc_typehints_type:\:py\:class\:\~anndata._core.anndata.AnnData`   :param adata: AnnData object with samples in.obsand genes in.var_names.    :type keys: :sphinx_autodoc_typehints_type::py:class:`list`\ \[:py:class:`str`]   :param keys: List of variables to plot. Each key can be either:                 - name of a column inadata.obs(QC/clinical/signature scores), or                 - a gene name found inadata.var_names(expression will be taken fromlayer).    :type groupby: :sphinx_autodoc_typehints_type::py:class:`str`   :param groupby: Categorical column inadata.obs used to define groups on the x-axis.    :type layer: :sphinx_autodoc_typehints_type::py:class:`str` | :py:obj:`None`   :param layer: Layer to use for gene expression keys (default:”log1p_cpm”).                  If None, uses adata.X.    :type figsize: :sphinx_autodoc_typehints_type::py:class:`tuple`\ \[:py:class:`float`, :py:class:`float`]   :param figsize: Base figure size(width, height) in inches.                    If multiple keys are provided, the final width is scaled by the number of panels.    :type panel_size: :sphinx_autodoc_typehints_type::py:data:`~typing.Optional`\ \[:py:class:`tuple`\ \[:py:class:`float`, :py:class:`float`]]   :param panel_size: Alternative tofigsize: size per panel (width, height)in inches.                       If provided, overridesfigsize.    :type show_points: :sphinx_autodoc_typehints_type::py:class:`bool`    :param show_points: Whether to overlay individual samples as points (strip plot).    :type point_size: :sphinx_autodoc_typehints_type::py:class:`float`    :param point_size: Point size for the overlaid samples.    :type point_alpha: :sphinx_autodoc_typehints_type::py:class:`float`    :param point_alpha: Transparency for the overlaid points.    :type palette: :sphinx_autodoc_typehints_type::py:data:`~typing.Optional`\ \[:py:class:`str`]   :param palette: Categorical palette name (matplotlib/seaborn). IfNone, uses global defaults.    :type order: :sphinx_autodoc_typehints_type::py:data:`~typing.Optional`\ \[:py:class:`list`\ \[:py:class:`str`]]   :param order: Explicit order of categories forgroupby. If None, uses category order in adata.obs[groupby].    :type rotate_xticks: :sphinx_autodoc_typehints_type::py:class:`float`    :param rotate_xticks: Rotation angle (degrees) for x-axis tick labels.    :type inner: :sphinx_autodoc_typehints_type::py:class:`str`   :param inner: Passed toseaborn.violinplot(inner=…)(e.g.”quartile”, “box”, None).    :type cut: :sphinx_autodoc_typehints_type::py:class:`float`   :param cut: Passed toseaborn.violinplot(cut=…).    :type save: :sphinx_autodoc_typehints_type::py:data:`~typing.Union`\ \[:py:class:`str`, :py:class:`~pathlib.Path`, :py:obj:`None`]    :param save: If provided, path to save the figure.    :type show: :sphinx_autodoc_typehints_type::py:class:`bool`   :param show: If True, displays the plot (matplotlibplt.show()`).

:returns: * fig – Matplotlib Figure. * axes – Array/list of Axes for each panel.

.. rubric:: Notes

  • If groupby is numeric with many unique values, consider converting it to a categorical.

  • For gene keys, missing genes are ignored/raised depending on implementation; see error message.

.. seealso::

  :obj:`bullkpy.pl.gene_association`
      association tests for genes vs categories

  :obj:`bullkpy.tl.score_genes`
      compute signature scores for plotting in violin

.. rubric:: Examples

QC variables:

bk.pl.violin(adata, keys=[“total_counts”, “pct_counts_mt”], groupby=”Project_ID”)

Gene expression:

bk.pl.violin(adata, keys=[“DLL3”, “SOX10”], groupby=”Subtype_PAM50”, layer=”log1p_cpm”)

Control category order and tick rotation:

bk.pl.violin( … adata, … keys=[“CDC20”], … groupby=”Project_ID”, … order=[“LUAD”, “LUSC”, “BRCA”], … rotate_xticks=90, … )
